ngiemboon: Áa na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mbà mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, pi ne ńkága kǎg ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ń de kʉ́a léŋweʼe ŋwàʼne ńnáa mbwó pi lélɔg ńkímte gẅí mmó gie n ka zɔɔn ńgɔɔn mbwó pi wɔ́. Á ge peʼe gẅí légwe na mejÿɔʼ.
en: In addition, my brothers and sisters, rejoice   in the Lord. To write to you again about this is no trouble for me and is a safeguard for you.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn pazíʼi pʉ̀a mmó pie ée pe tepòŋ! Mefàʼ mɔ́b ée mbwó Ssé, ésẅile sẅile! Ayɔ́b nò gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie mé lɔɔn te nyìŋ púʼ, e Ssé legÿo á tsẅɛ́ wɔ́.
en: Watch out for the dogs, watch out for the evil   workers, watch out for those who mutilate the flesh.

ngiemboon: Pege pɔɔn zɔ ee pʉ̀a pie mé la kwàʼ ḿbúʼu wégè. Pege zɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é ne guʼte Ssé, ńne ńzẅíʼte nò ncwò Zẅìge yé. Pege lɔgɔ pɔ́ Yěsô ńkaʼte, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pege zɔɔn le lɔg shúm sie pʉ̀a mesoŋ gÿo ńtí mà láʼ wɔb ńdɔg ńkaʼte wɔ́.
en: For we are the circumcision,   the ones who worship by the Spirit  # 3:3 Rm 8:4; Gl 5:25; 1Tm 3:16 of God, boast in Christ Jesus,  # 3:3 Rm 16:7; Eph 2:6; Php 1:1,15; 1Pt 5:14 and do not put confidence in the flesh #— #

ngiemboon: Táʼ, n gee nyìŋ gẅie n gwéʼe ńkwoŋ, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n dɔg shúm sie mé gÿo ńtíi mà láʼ weg ńdɔg ńkaʼte. Tà ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn ngie à zsé nò mǒ, mbà n ge shwóŋo yé yɔ́ɔn ngie n zsé nò mǒ ńcʉa yé.
en: although I have reasons for confidence in the flesh. If anyone else thinks he has grounds for confidence in the flesh, I have more:

ngiemboon: Mé la zyé wɔ́ɔn, é cʉa lyɛ̌ʼ lefɔ̌ɔn, mé púʼu wɔ́ɔn. N gee nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ Ésàlayɛ, á na tsìŋendá Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ Ébɛ̀ tà metá pɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ pɔ́ pa Ébɛ̀, ńgʉa na lepʉ̌ pʉ̀a Ébɛ̀, n gwɔ́ nyìŋ na nùɔ pafalísáyè.
en: circumcised the eighth day;   of the nation of Israel,  # 3:5 Rm 9:6 of the tribe of Benjamin,  # 3:5 Ps 68:27 a Hebrew born of Hebrews; regarding the law,  # 3:5 Ac 5:34; 22:3; Gl 1:14; 5:4 a Pharisee;

ngiemboon: N dɔ̌ɔn ńtíɛ kẅǐ na lepʉ̌ tɛʼ, tà ńtsɔ́ʼɔ kwò pʉ̀a Keleto té poŋ. Lekuʼté tsẅéláʼ zɔ laa pɛ́ʼɛ̀ ńtyɛʼte ngie nyìŋ aa tefʉ̀a, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí ngie n daa tefʉ̀a.
en: regarding zeal,   persecuting  # 3:6 Ac 22:2–5; 26:9–11; 1Co 15:9; Gl 1:13; 1Tm 1:13; 2Tm 3:12 the church; regarding the righteousness that is in the law,  # 3:6 Rm 3:21; 9:31; 10:4–5; Gl 2:21; 3:21 blameless.  # 3:6 Lk 1:6; Rm 7:9–10

ngiemboon: Táʼ, mɔɔn menò ŋwɛ́ mie é laa mbwó mèŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lemaŋ, Keleto leen ńgÿo n gyá, mbà é la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pyé.
en: But everything that was a gain to me, I have considered to be a loss because of Christ.

ngiemboon: É té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndàʼ púʼu wɔ́, lezsé Yěsô Keleto, á Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn, zɔ cʉ̌ʼ ńcʉa nò ntsèm. Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pyé. Mbà n déen ńdʉʼ shúm ntsèm ńtí pɔ́ yé. N cʉ̌ʼ ńdíe sɛ̌ shúm ntsèm, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ kʉ̀ŋe. Keleto zɔ̌ cʉ́ʼʉ yɔ́ɔn pì,
en: More than that, I also consider everything to be a loss in view of the surpassing value   of knowing Christ  # 3:8 Jn 17:3; 2Co 4:6; Gl 4:8–9; Php 1:15; Col 2:2; 1Jn 4:8 Jesus my Lord. Because of him I have suffered the loss of all things and consider them as dung, so that I may gain Christ  # 3:8 1Pt 3:1

ngiemboon: légwɔ́ gie n ge cʉ́ʼ gwɔ́ pɔ́ na mbwó mé, ngwɔ́ ń de gíŋ ngie n gee tefʉ̀a mvfò Ssé, mélàʼmie n zsé lepʉ̌ pà Yúndà wɔ́. N gee mvfò yé ńgwɔ́ tefʉ̀a ńtí pɔ́ nò gie n záb ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn na Keleto, e Ssé zɔ gÿo ngie n gwɔ́ nyìŋ nénʉ́ páʼ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé na Keleto.
en: and be found in him, not having a righteousness of my own from the law,   but one that is through faith in Christ  # 3:9 Or through the faithfulness of Christ  #— #the righteousness from God based on faith.  # 3:9 Rm 3:22; 10:4; Gl 2:21; Heb 11:7

ngiemboon: N ne ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ tàʼa nò wémɔʼɔ́. Á gwɔ́ ngie n zsé yé Keleto, ńzsé metʉ̀ mie é la gÿo á zíme na legwé, ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ páʼ à la gyá yé, ńzẅíŋe lénáa twó yɔ́ɔn ńkwé páʼ à la náa yé,
en: My goal is to know him and the power of his resurrection and the fellowship of his sufferings,   being conformed to his death,  # 3:10 Rm 6:5; 8:36; 2Co 4:7–12; 12:9–10; Gl 6:17

ngiemboon: légwɔ́ gie á lɔɔn te gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie kà áa lêkɔ́ wɔ́ɔ wɔ́, e Ssé láʼ ńgÿo n zím yɔ́ɔn na legwé páʼ Keleto.
en: assuming that I will somehow reach the resurrection from among the dead.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ń de gɔɔn ngie n kuʼu na mɔɔn menò ntsèm mie n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lɔɔn wɔ́. N ké le gɔɔn ngie n cʉʼʉ́ nyìŋ gẅie tsɔ́ mmó té gíŋ ńne ńzága na yé wɔ́ wɔ́. N nyé mánzsè, ńtsaa ndʉ̌, ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ páʼ Keleto, mélàʼmie à kéen ńzába pwó na mèŋ ńtí púʼu.
en: Not that I have already reached the goal or am already perfect, but I make every effort to take hold   of it because I also have been taken hold of by Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, ngwɔ́ ń de gɔɔn ngie n nɔɔnté tà ḿbú ńgwɔ́ páʼ Keleto wɔ́, n ne ńgÿo pɔ́ tàʼa mmó, á gwɔ́ légwaa gÿo mmó, ńdege Kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie n ka gÿo, ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńdíe pɔ́ gie áa mvfò.
en: Brothers and sisters, I do not   consider myself to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind  # 3:13 Lk 9:62; 17:31 and reaching forward to what is ahead,

ngiemboon: N gee mánzsè ńtsaa pɔ́ ndʉ̌, lékúu jʉʼ gie n gee né wó ńkẅé ntsɔʼɔ́fàʼ gẅie Ssé la kaʼ lénáa mbwó pege, á tÿǒ lepwó ńtí nò gie Keleto la kwé na twó ségè.
en: I pursue as my goal the prize promised by God’s heavenly   call in Christ Jesus.  # 3:14 Rm 16:7; Eph 2:6; Php 1:1,15; 1Pt 5:14

ngiemboon: Pege pie pege vfoté na nò Ssé, á poŋ ngie e wégè nkwaŋá e gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼɔɔn, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie etsɔ́ pʉ̀a pi gẅiin tsɔ́ nkwaŋá tà é té wɔɔn wɔ́, mbà Ssé ge shʉashʉa, éshwóŋo gẅí nò gie áa yɛ̌.
en: Therefore, let all of us who are mature think this way. And if you think differently about anything, God will reveal   this also to you.

ngiemboon: Anò gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, ajʉʼ gie pege gʉ̌a tà ńkúu wó lɔɔn, pege ké ńgʉa pɔ́ lé mvfò.
en: In any case, we should live up to whatever truth we have attained.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, pi metsèm, pi pí fʉ̀ʼ na mèŋ. Peg ka nyɛɛ gẅí páʼ pi ge giŋ púʼu. Pi líe pʉ̀a pie é ne ńgiŋe púʼu, ńgiŋ gí.
en: Join in imitating me, brothers and sisters, and pay careful attention to those who live according to the example you have in us.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, mà wɔb sẅé pɔ́ we pʉ̀a pie é nyiŋe legwé Keleto na tÿǒnkǐ nyiŋe. N dǎ zye shwóŋo gẅí, tà mbɔɔ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, n giŋé ńne ńgɔɔn tà ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ ntse nÿɔ́g ńgɔɔn.
en: For I have often told you, and now say again with tears, that many live as enemies of the cross   of Christ.

ngiemboon: Emɔ́b melyɛ̌ʼ ge láʼ maga tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, pɔ́ gee lepÿé mmɔ̌g, mélàʼmie yɔb ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ lepfòm sɔ́b. Pɔ́ kága na mmó gie eshʉ́ kɔʼɔ́ kúu wɔ́b mǒ kǔ, ewɔ́b nkwaŋá piŋ ńtyé pɔ́ na shúm njÿó.
en: Their end is destruction; their god is their stomach; their glory   is in their shame; and they are focused on earthly things.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na pege, mbà wégè ngwòŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó. Pege ne ńzẅíʼte ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto fó wó ńtó, ńgÿo pege tsẅɛ́.
en: Our citizenship is in heaven, and we eagerly wait for a Savior from there, the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo sele yɔɔn mbùm nnɛ́ gie e te na tsɔ́ nò kuʼ lɔɔn, e cʉ́ʼ gie e gẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g. À gwɔ́ púʼu, ńdɔgɔ metʉ̀ mie à gẅiin lélɔg ńgÿo akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ cʉ́ʼʉ ńjúʼu pɔ́ ncwò yé.
en: He will transform the body of our humble condition into the likeness of his glorious   body,  # 3:21 1Co 6:13; 1Jn 3:2 by the power that enables him to subject everything to himself.
